column2: Confucian Bureaucracies rely on a set of strict imperial examinations to select their rulers. Candidates are tested on their knowledge of the Confucian Classics - though merit, previous achievements and recommendations from prominent aristocrats also play a major role in the selection process. Rulers tend to be very skilled stewards.
column3: Les bureaucraties confucéennes s'appuient sur des examens impériaux stricts pour sélectionner leurs dirigeants. Les candidats sont testés sur leurs connaissances des Classiques confucéens - en dehors du mérite, les accomplissements précédents et les recommandations d'aristocrates en vue jouent aussi un rôle majeur dans le processus de sélection. Les dirigeants ont tendance à être des intendants très compétents.
column4: Konfuzianische Bürokraten verlassen sich auf eine Reihe von strengen kaiserlichen Prüfungen, um ihre Herrscher auszuwählen. Die Kandidaten werden auf ihre Kenntnisse der konfuzianischen Klassiker getestet, wobei Verdienst, frühere Errungenschaften und Empfehlungen von prominenten Aristokraten auch eine wichtige Rolle bei der Auswahl spielen. Herrscher neigen dazu, sehr erfahrene Kämmerer zu sein.
column6: Las burocracias confucianas recurren a una serie de rigurosos exámenes imperiales para elegir a sus gobernantes. Los candidatos prueban su conocimiento de los clásicos confucianos. Aunque méritos, logros previos y recomendaciones de aristócratas destacados también desempeñan un papel importante en el proceso de selección. Los gobernantes suelen ser administradores hábiles.

column2: Inspired by the Chinese government, the Japanese Imperial government is in many ways similar to regular feudalism but differs on some points.
Only Chinese, Japanese, Ryukyuan, Koreanic, Viet, Jurchen, Tangut, Khitan, Mongol, and Kaifeng rulers can use the Chinese Imperial government.
There are no cultural restrictions on the Chinese Imperial government form
Chinese Imperial realms have to contend with the Mandate of Heaven mechanic, which can give them both advantages and disadvantages
Chinese Imperial realms do not have to contend with the Mandate of Heaven mechanic.

It is a truth universally acknowledged that [Root.GetTitledName] possesses the Mandate of Heaven, as would be expected from the ruler of the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. While there might be a handful of people who wish otherwise, it is doubtful that this will not be a golden era for [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].\n\nMay your rule last for ten thousand years!

While there are whispers that [Root.GetTitledName] might not posses the Mandate of Heaven, there are few who would dare to voice such accusations publicly. The situation in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is becoming more stable, and foreign realms also look more kindly on you.\n\nUnless the situation rapidly worsens, it is likely that people soon will stop questioning your right to rule entirely.

As the ruler of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], [Root.GetTitledName] is supposed to possess the Mandate of Heaven. While there are those that doubt that you do possess it, there are not many that would accuse you of having lost it outright.\n\nIf the situation continues to improve, people will become even more willing to acknowledge that you possess the Mandate.

Once, it was a truth universally acknowledged that [Root.GetTitledName] did not possess the Mandate of Heaven. Those days are now behind you, even if there still are many who doubt you.\n\nIf the situation continues to improve, chances are that both internal and external threats will diminish significantly, though at present these still are interesting times.
As if there was any doubt!

Once, it was a truth universally acknowledged that the ruler of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] possessed the Mandate of Heaven. However, those days are now behind you, and there are whispers suggesting that [Root.GetTitledName] perhaps is not in possession of the Mandate.\n\nThe situation is still stable enough, as none dare question you openly, but if matters do not improve it is possible that we will experience significant trouble.

It is becoming increasingly clear that the world is unconvinced that [Root.GetTitledName] possesses the Mandate of Heaven. While people are not outright accusing you of having lost it completely, it is clear that you do not command the respect you once did.\n\nUnless the situation improves, there might be trouble on the horizon, both from within your borders and from without.

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is supposed to be ruled by a ruler that possesses the Mandate of Heaven, but it is becoming impossible to ignore the fact that there are many who doubt that [Root.GetTitledName] is in possession of it, and there are doubtlessly those who are starting to consider taking advantage of the situation.\n\nIf matters do not improve, your realm might experience considerable turmoil.

It is a truth universally acknowledged that [Root.GetTitledName] no longer possesses the Mandate of Heaven. [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is experiencing significant internal turmoil, and the rest of the world does not look upon you with kind eyes.\n\nIf the situation does not improve rapidly, this may well herald the end of your dynasty's rule over [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName].
